intro: Hieracium morphophidum, commonly known as the spiked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, while its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Hieracium morphophidum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a common weed in disturbed soils.
